definition: trainer
to teach/to train/to admonish/instruction (from superiors)/teachings/rule
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: People who train with clickers or markers and never correct a dog also fall into this category.
sentences.chinese: 響片訓練者從不使用糾正，也屬於這類人。

sentences.english: The trainer appeared, followed by six little dogs.
sentences.chinese: 訓練者出現了，後面跟着六條小狗。

sentences.english: Clicker purists will disagree with using luring.
sentences.chinese: 純粹的響片訓練者不同意使用誘導。

sentences.english: The third category of dog trainer is the where I strive to be.
sentences.chinese: 第三類訓練者是我正努力達到的目標。

sentences.english: The cat suddenly turned on its trainer.
sentences.chinese: 這隻貓突然轉而進攻它的訓練者。

sentences.english: Persons receiving vocational training in vocational training institutes registered with the government;
sentences.chinese: 六在政府登記有案之職業訓練機構接受訓練者。

emotional state
the young (unborn or newborn) of an animal/larva
historical materialism (Marx's theory of history)

definition: to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
desktop computer
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
likes and dislikes
selfie stick/also written 自拍杆[zi4 pai1 gan1]
maggot
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
Quran (Islamic scripture)
sb who tries to be on good terms with everyone
